snippet.title: Running Shoes
snippet.description: When Sophy is given a pair of running shoes her life changes forever -because now she can go to school. This sensitive and warm story is of a young girl's desire for knowledge and her one chance to attain it.

snippet.title: Little Red Running Shoes
snippet.description: This is the story of a six-year-old boy, Jack, nicknamed Little Red Running Shoes because he loved to wear his red running shoes everywhere he went.

snippet.title: Running Times - Jan 2006 - Page 78
snippet.description: The readers may not always be right, but they often write, as did one who has been "running in and collecting shoes since the late '70s." "Why not a column on shoes that broke new ground?" You mean trail shoes with big honkin' backhoe-like ...

snippet.description: BY J.D. DENTON Thirty years is a lot of running shoes. f you started running the day the first issue of Running Times hit the roads, and you averaged, say, 25 miles per week since, let's see... that's 25 miles times 52 weeks per year divided by ...

snippet.title: Running Times - Mar 2007 - Page 78
snippet.description: The product manager at the head of the conference table had just introduced her company's line of running shoes to the dozen or so Shoe Guys present. It was quickly clear to me why this brand wasn't on my wall, and my mind wandered to ...

snippet.title: Running Times - Dec 2006 - Page 78
snippet.description: What you probably don't want to do right now is go out and buy a second pair of running shoes while the pair you wore this morning still has a good two or three hundred miles of life in them. Then again, maybe you should. While most runners ...

snippet.title: Running Times - Jul 2007 - Page 78
snippet.description: He had written a piece on the evils of so-called discount running shoes sold in big stores that smell like popcorn. (Imagery mine; he referred to them as Target and Kohl's.) His point was that you pretty much get what you pay for. In a world ...

snippet.title: Running Times - Oct 2006 - Page 78
snippet.description: Change in running shoes is, of course, inevitable, and while it's not always good, it's also not inherently evil. It's good if it better serves the running population, which also is always changing. A shoe guy frozen in time only a couple of decades ...

snippet.title: Running Times - Jan 2008 - Page 86
snippet.description: We consume millions of running shoes every year, and not only do we need to start questioning what happens when we're done with them, but also what it takes to deliver them. OK, so you go through running shoes like Paris Hilton goes ...
